pageContext.description:
This full-length portrait of Prince Christian I of Saxony (1560-1591) at the age of four belongs to a series of six portraits completed between 1563 and 1565, depicting Elector Augustus of Saxony (1526-1586), his wife, Princess Anna of Denmark (1532–1585) and his four children. Christian I is shown here facing left, standing on a marble floor and casting a shadow on the neutral background. He is wearing a skirted coat of plain velvet with gold brocade trimmings and a pair of puffed trunks. The white ruffed shirt is visible at the neck and his cylindrical velvet hat is decorated with gold embroidery and a feather. His attire is completed by two large linked chains.
[cda 2021]

pageContext.provenance:
- 1806 recorded in the catalogue of the Picture Gallery at the Dresden court (nos. 316, 317)
- 1860 transferred to the 'Obermarschallamt' (Marschal Services) for decorative purposes
- 1924 transferred to the House of Wettin within the context of the Expropriation of the Princes in the Weimar Republic
- in the collection of Prince Ernst Heinrich, Duke of Saxony, Moritzburg[1]
- private collection
